page.title: 13INDUSTRY
page.content: With the building of the M.62 motorway which is able to connect Brighouse with both the east and west coast and the other major motorways of Britain, many factories have been built on the large industrial estate in the valley bottom along the banks of the River Calder.Many of the old textile mills near the town centre have been closed in recent years and many jobs can now be found in the new factories. The largest space in the industrial estate is taken up by British Car Auctions,one of the largest auction centres in the north of England. Other industries on the estate include the packaging of food, the making of hi-fi equipment, engineering and textiles. There is also a marina for pleasure craft which use the canal.Many roads lead onto the estate from the town centre via the Dewsbury/Brighouse road
